content: @WG-rustc-dev-guide :wave:
I had a ton of personal things going on and couldn't start this before, sorry
I guess one of the main important things that we may want to talk about is #t-compiler/wg-rustc-dev-guide > GloRuWriClu Sign Up
@Doc Jones do you want to talk about this briefly?
I guess ... given that we didn't start this on time maybe nobody is around
but anyway @Doc Jones, if you want to talk about GloRuWriClu in general and about the sign up in particular, go ahead and share whatevery ou feel is important

The initiative is to approach two goals. 1) to build a cohort or group that will work on the rustc dev guide and 2) to provide a vehicle for people new to compiler to contribute to the dev guide and learn more about the compiler internals.
The GloRuWriClu is a model that will be applied to multiple documentation efforts. Team leads who have stepped forward to try it out include rustc-dev-guide, The Async Book and rustup.
I was presented to CTCFT meeting on July 19th and it was decided to move forward with the rustc-dev-guide first.

The signup form helps in two ways. Collecting time zone data from cohort members will help up to choose a reasonable time for the kickoff meeting on September 7th. And we can have some idea of how many people will be in the cohort.

The compiler is has supported us by creating and updating the expert map, so that we have identified experts for some areas of the compiler who will review our work. There are no doubt some areas of the compiler that the cohort will identify that aren't in the map, yet.

If you want to contribute to the rustc-dev-guide, please take a moment to complete the sign up form.
GloRuWriClu Sign Up form.
I'm really excited about the initiative and plan to have fun working on it. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out here or send me a PM.

To learn more about how it works check this doc.
https://hackmd.io/69FQfH3PSOSJA3GHQ-5R2w
And finally, I'm working on a blog post for Inside Rust. Once it is live I'll post a link here.
@Santiago Pastorino Did you want me to cover anything else?
